alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding and overflowing in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. River and stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen this morning, on top of the 2 to 4 inch amounts from Sunday. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Derry, Biddeford, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Alfred, Sanford and Salem.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
